page.title: 11BOTO-X 1985
page.content: During the spring of 1985 a new word was to be seen around the town of Devizes. This word was "BOTO-X" - pronounced "Boato-cross". The inhabi- tants of Devizes wondered what this strange word could mean. Gradually its meaning became clear. There was to be a race on the pounds beside the flight of locks of the Kennet and Avon Canal just outside the town. The purpose of the event was to raise funds for The Kennet and Avon Canal Trust and The Bath Cancer Unit, which provides treatment and facilities for patients from a large area of the West Country. The Kennet and Avon Canal Trust hoped that this event would emphasise the suitability of the canal and its environs for family recreation. The weekend of July 22nd and 23rd was devoted to this event.
